VIPSPage.PageTitle: Welcome to The 34th Annual ACM SIGIR Conference

LayoutNode.SRC: • Call for Papers(Closed)
• Call for Workshops(Closed)
• Call for Posters/Demos(Closed)
• Call for Tutorials(Closed)
• Call for Doctoral Consortium Submissions(Closed)
• Request for Mentoring(Closed)
Instructions for Preparing Contributions
• Paper Submission(Closed)

LayoutNode.Content: SIGIR is the major international forum for the presentation of new research results and for the demonstration of new systems and techniques in the broad field of information retrieval (IR). The Conference and Program Chairs invite all those working in areas related to IR to submit original papers, posters, and proposals for tutorials, workshops, and demonstrations of systems. SIGIR 2011 welcomes contributions related to any aspect of IR theory and foundation, techniques, and applications. Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:
LayoutNode.SRC: SIGIR is the major international forum for the presentation of new research results and for the demonstration of new systems and techniques in the broad field of information retrieval (IR). The Conference and Program Chairs invite all those working in areas related to IR to submit original papers, posters, and proposals for tutorials, workshops, and demonstrations of systems. SIGIR 2011 welcomes contributions related to any aspect of IR theory and foundation, techniques, and applications. Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

LayoutNode.Content: Document Representation and Content Analysis (e.g., text representation, document structure, linguistic analysis, non-English IR, cross-lingual IR, information extraction, sentiment analysis, clustering, classification, topic models, facets)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Document Representation and Content Analysis (e.g., text representation, document structure, linguistic analysis, non-English IR, cross-lingual IR, information extraction, sentiment analysis, clustering, classification, topic models, facets)

LayoutNode.Content: Queries and Query Analysis (e.g., query representation, query intent, query log analysis, question answering, query suggestion, query reformulation)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Queries and Query Analysis (e.g., query representation, query intent, query log analysis, question answering, query suggestion, query reformulation)

LayoutNode.Content: Users and Interactive IR (e.g., user models, user studies, user feedback, search interface, summarization, task models, personalized search)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Users and Interactive IR (e.g., user models, user studies, user feedback, search interface, summarization, task models, personalized search)

LayoutNode.Content: Retrieval Models and Ranking (e.g., IR theory, language models, probabilistic retrieval models, feature-based models, learning to rank, combining searches, diversity)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Retrieval Models and Ranking (e.g., IR theory, language models, probabilistic retrieval models, feature-based models, learning to rank, combining searches, diversity)

LayoutNode.Content: Search Engine Architectures and Scalability ( e.g., indexing, compression, MapReduce, distributed IR, P2P IR, mobile devices)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Search Engine Architectures and Scalability ( e.g., indexing, compression, MapReduce, distributed IR, P2P IR, mobile devices)

LayoutNode.Content: Filtering and Recommending (e.g., content-based filtering, collaborative filtering, recommender systems, profiles)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Filtering and Recommending (e.g., content-based filtering, collaborative filtering, recommender systems, profiles)

LayoutNode.Content: Evaluation (e.g., test collections, effectiveness measures, experimental design)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Evaluation (e.g., test collections, effectiveness measures, experimental design)

LayoutNode.Content: Web IR and Social Media Search (e.g., link analysis, query logs, social tagging, social network analysis, advertising and search, blog search, forum search, CQA, adversarial IR, vertical and local search)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Web IR and Social Media Search (e.g., link analysis, query logs, social tagging, social network analysis, advertising and search, blog search, forum search, CQA, adversarial IR, vertical and local search)

LayoutNode.Content: IR and Structured Data (e.g., XML search, ranking in databases, desktop search, entity search)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>IR and Structured Data (e.g., XML search, ranking in databases, desktop search, entity search)

LayoutNode.Content: Multimedia IR (e.g., Image search, video search, speech/audio search, music IR)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Multimedia IR (e.g., Image search, video search, speech/audio search, music IR)

LayoutNode.Content: Other Applications (e.g., digital libraries, enterprise search, genomics IR, legal IR, patent search, text reuse)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Other Applications (e.g., digital libraries, enterprise search, genomics IR, legal IR, patent search, text reuse)

LayoutNode.Content: To maintain a reasonable acceptance rate in the face of growing numbers of submissions, SIGIR 2011 will be exploring alternative presentations for full papers. For example, depending on the number of accepted full papers, the program committee may select some of those papers to be presented as posters in a special track according to the nature of the paper. This would be different than the poster session for the late-breaking research ideas, which will continue as in previous years.
LayoutNode.SRC: To maintain a reasonable acceptance rate in the face of growing numbers of submissions, SIGIR 2011 will be exploring alternative presentations for full papers. For example, depending on the number of accepted full papers, the program committee may select some of those papers to be presented as posters in a special track according to the nature of the paper. This would be different than the poster session for the late-breaking research ideas, which will continue as in previous years.

LayoutNode.Content: 17 Jan 2011 : Abstracts for full research papers due
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>17 Jan 2011 : Abstracts for full research papers due

LayoutNode.Content: 24 Jan 2011 : Full research paper submissions due
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>24 Jan 2011 : Full research paper submissions due

LayoutNode.Content: 11 Feb 2011 : Posters, demonstration, and tutorial proposals due
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>11 Feb 2011 : Posters, demonstration, and tutorial proposals due

LayoutNode.Content: The SIGIR paper submission process includes the submission of an abstract a week prior to the full paper submission deadline. SIGIR has adopted this policy ever since we started requesting abstracts a week before the paper deadline, so that the bidding process can proceed efficiently. To ensure equal treatment for all contributors:
LayoutNode.SRC: The SIGIR paper submission process includes the submission of an abstract a week prior to the full paper submission deadline. SIGIR has adopted this policy ever since we started requesting abstracts a week before the paper deadline, so that the bidding process can proceed efficiently. To ensure equal treatment for all contributors:

LayoutNode.Content: No full paper will be accepted if it does not correspond to an abstract submitted on time
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>No full paper will be accepted if it does not correspond to an abstract submitted on time

LayoutNode.Content: No late submission of abstract will be accepted
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>No late submission of abstract will be accepted

LayoutNode.Content: No late submission of full paper will be accepted
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>No late submission of full paper will be accepted

LayoutNode.Content: Guidelines for paper format and appropriate content are described in the content guidelines . Some changes have been made this year so be sure to read this page carefully.
LayoutNode.SRC: Guidelines for paper format and appropriate content are described in the content guidelines . Some changes have been made this year so be sure to read this page carefully.

LayoutNode.Content: In particular, the length limit has been increased to 10 pages.
LayoutNode.SRC: In particular, the length limit has been increased to 10 pages.

LayoutNode.Content: Jian-Yun Nie, University of Montreal, Canada
Wei-Ying Ma, Microsoft Research Asia, China
Tat-Seng Chua, National University of Singapore
W. Bruce Croft, University of Massachusetts, Amherst, USA
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>W. Bruce Croft, University of Massachusetts, Amherst, USA

LayoutNode.Content: Information on how to submit will be available by mid-December, 2009.
LayoutNode.SRC: Information on how to submit will be available by mid-December, 2009.

LayoutNode.Content: For other details, please see the conference web site: http://www.sigir2011.org/
LayoutNode.SRC: For other details, please see the conference web site: http://www.sigir2011.org/
